poem:
Title: Shuttered Mirth

In Menorca's sun-bathed earth,
Dance noble horses of pure birth,
Cloaked in festivity and mirth.
Through the lens, a sight to see,
A carnival of jubilee,
Dressage wound in island key.
Through the screen, he views this song,
A tapestry spun long and strong,
In technicolour strung along.
The phone, a spyglass, taking part,
Distilling beauty, sweet art,
From voyeur's view, to beating heart.
